alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 6:09AM CDT until August 22 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southern Haskell and southwestern Throckmorton Counties in West Central Texas. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing of poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 607 AM CDT, Radar indicated showers and thunderstorms with heavy rain. Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches will occur in less than an hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Haskell, Stamford, Lake Stamford Marina, Irby and Paint Creek. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Loop Road crossing Paint Creek and County Road 279 crossing North Paint Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
